stem: A client with acute pancreatitis reports severe epigastric pain radiating to the back. Serum Amylase and Lipase are significantly elevated. Complete the bowtie to manage this client.

rationale.correct: Autodigestion of the pancreas causes severe pain and fluid shifts. Priorities are NPO (stop enzyme secretion) and IV fluids. Monitoring glucose is vital as the endocrine function of the pancreas may be impaired.
rationale.incorrect: Fatty foods trigger enzyme release and worsen pain. PO enzymes (Pancrelipase) are for chronic pancreatitis, not acute crisis. NG residual is for enteral feeding, not NPO status monitoring.
clinicalPearls: The client may find relief in the fetal position or by leaning forward.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Lipase is more specific to the pancreas and stays elevated longer than amylase.

reviewUnits.heading: Priority Interventions for Acute Pancreatitis
reviewUnits.body: The priority nursing interventions are: Maintain NPO status (Bowel rest); Initiate IV Fluid resuscitation. Monitor: Pain level (Scale 1-10); Blood Glucose levels. Fatty foods trigger enzyme release and worsen pain. PO enzymes (Pancrelipase) are for chronic pancreatitis, not acute crisis. NG residual is for enteral feeding, not NPO status monitoring.
